snippet: Two proposals would crack down on nongovernmental organizations and enforce controls over ideology and culture, all in the name of national security.
abstract: Editorial commends more than 40 American trade associations and lobbying groups who are pushing back against Chinese proposals that would crack down on freedom of nongovernment organizations in country; welcomes their firmness in warning that laws could inhibit their ability to contribute to Chinese economy, saying it demonstrates power that foreign businesses can wield in challenging nation's authoritarianism.
lead_paragraph: Two proposals would crack down on nongovernmental organizations and enforce controls over ideology and culture, all in the name of national security.

headline.print_headline: Western Business Stands Up to China
headline.main: Western Business Stands Up to China

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations
